DataElement.preferredName: Plasma Cell Polymerase Chain Reaction Cytomegalovirus Positive Finding Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date a cytomegalovirus positive finding was detected using plasma cell polymerase chain reaction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Plasma Cell Polymerase Chain Reaction Cytomegalovirus Positive Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody._A method for amplifying a DNA base sequence using multiple rounds of heat denaturation of the DNA and annealing of oligonucleotide primers complementary to flanking regions in the presence of a heat-stable polymerase.  This results in duplication of the targeted DNA region. Newly synthesized DNA strands can subsequently serve as additional templates for the same primer sequences, so that successive rounds of primer annealing, strand elongation, and dissociation produce rapid and highly specific amplification of the desired sequence. PCR also can be used to detect the existence of the defined sequence in a DNA sample.:An indication that cytomegalovirus has been detected in a sample._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody._A method for amplifying a DNA base sequence using multiple rounds of heat denaturation of the DNA and annealing of oligonucleotide primers complementary to flanking regions in the presence of a heat-stable polymerase.  This results in duplication of the targeted DNA region. Newly synthesized DNA strands can subsequently serve as additional templates for the same primer sequences, so that successive rounds of primer annealing, strand elongation, and dissociation produce rapid and highly specific amplification of the desired sequence. PCR also can be used to detect the existence of the defined sequence in a DNA sample.

Concepts.definition: A fully mature B-Cell that produces a specific antibody.

A method for amplifying a DNA base sequence using multiple rounds of heat denaturation of the DNA and annealing of oligonucleotide primers complementary to flanking regions in the presence of a heat-stable polymerase.  This results in duplication of the targeted DNA region. Newly synthesized DNA strands can subsequently serve as additional templates for the same primer sequences, so that successive rounds of primer annealing, strand elongation, and dissociation produce rapid and highly specific amplification of the desired sequence. PCR also can be used to detect the existence of the defined sequence in a DNA sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that cytomegalovirus has been detected in a sample._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: An indication that cytomegalovirus has been detected in a sample.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
